item.title: Making a Better Map Part 2: ggplot and Tigris
item.description: Continuing Where we Left Off In Part One of this series we worked on getting data using the TidyCensus package to recreate the map below from a recent New York Times Story. Now we’re going to actually do the mapping bit. It Floats…kind of So this should be pretty straightforward: we’ve got a dataframe with shapefiles called bay_area_housing. It’s got one column with a shapefile of each census tract in the bay area and another with a ratio of dwellings where more than one person resides per room.
